eventDetails: *UPDATE TO EVENT* Please note going forward, I've introduced a suggested fee of ‚Ç¨5 (minimum). This can be paid in cash on the day. This will go towards the cost of MeetUp subscription, and is much appreciated. This event is Yoga only. 30-40 minute gentle yoga sequence, suitable for all levels and anyone interested in yoga, being outdoors/in nature, mindfulness etc. Dress for the weather and bring your own Yoga mat or towel. Location is across the wooden bridge, past Happy Out, at the beach entrance near the left. You'll find me on a green/orange yoga mat with a leopard print headband! We'll start at 09:30am, pick a spot you can see and hear me, and join in if you're running late. Any questions, please reach out. üôÇ (Date and time subject to change due to weather. In the event of cancellation, event status will be updated to cancelled and attendees will be messaged via MeetUp).

eventDetails: Meet in Ballinteer House at 10am and proceed towards Rathdrum. Appropriate footwear and clothing are required. While we give a certain amount of assistance, the walks are essentially self guided and we recommend that everyone take out their own personal insurance. We usually stop for a lunch on each walk so bring a light snack and drink.

Weekly yoga classes. Ranelagh 10.30am, Sundays. Classes are suitable for all levels, from those with no experience to those looking to deepen their practice, and the pace is set by the individual. I blend hundreds of hours of professional training and thousands of hours of teaching, mindfully crafting unique, informative and grounding classes, with lots of embodiment, breath focus, reflection and rest. I am a qualified Hatha, Yin and Restorative Yoga Teacher.
locationInfo: Off Lwr. Beechwood Avenue, Ranelagh, Dublin , al

eventDetails: We will meet at Trooperstown Carpark for 10.00am and follow this handy enough hike but it is still a mountain hike and a reasonable level of fitness is required. This will be 13km and 450ms ascent. Please have proper hiking boots and rain gear or you may not be allowed to hike with the group. Bring food and water for a 5 hour hike. No dogs, runners or jeans. We will got to Lynams for the food and coffee afterwards.

eventDetails:
Have fun alone or make your team and start walking through Dublin's best attractions solving riddles! Learn interesting things about the city and the attractions! Play an app led city game ! Take your companion or meet new teammates and test your co operation skills! Book your game on https://worldcitytrail.com/product/dublin-scavenger-hunt !
Cost: 10 EUR (50%) off, only for this group's members, apply coupon: MTP50 in your cart page! Have fun !

eventDetails:
Meeting at Knickeen Ford we will follow Table Track to the top where we swing off to Cavanaghs Gap and onto Lobawn. From Lobawn we drop down and over to Sugarloaf. Drop down from Sugarloaf and follow the forest roads back to the cars Distance: Almost 17km
Ascent 650m
Time: Approx 5.5 Hours

eventDetails: Sunday training at St.Mary's Hall Portlaoise

Training takes place on Sunday at Sean Moore Park, Rain, hail or sun, you will find us there. These sessions are fun and beginner friendly.
If you are new you only have to bring sports clothing and trainers. We provide all the material needed and we will show you how to play the sport. Come run around and have some fun :) As a safety requirement, currently all participants must be fully vaccinated.

eventDetails: Kayaking and SUP bording on Grand Canal trip, from Portobello Harbour to Inichore and back. Cover 5.5km and pass through six open bridges. Safety equipment and safety rules provided. The whole adventure will take about an hour or two hours, during which you will enjoy picturesque views and meet some river dwellers. Don‚Äôt worry if you never did it before: kayaking is easy to learn, and you‚Äôll be provided with instructions. Experienced kayakers are also welcome Booking the place. We Will Provide: What you need to bring Payment: You will have to pay a deposit of 5 euros (non-refundable if you don‚Äôt show up and refundable in case we have to cancel kayaking trip due to bad weather). To secure your RSVP a ‚Ç¨5 non-refundable deposit (the remaining ‚Ç¨15 to be paid in cash on the day) needs to be made via PAYPAL: paypal5@time-off.ie or Revolut on 0858313400 If you need to contact me directly my phone number is: 0858 313 400 Alex
eventName: Kayaking or SUP bording on Grand Canal Portobello, Dublin 2

groupName: Dreams, Past Lives & Spiritual Experiences- Eckankar Ireland
eventDetails:
Looking for some spiritual inspiration and conversation? Come and visit the Eckankar Book and Info Stand in the Blackrock Market, Blackrock, Co.Dublin.
We're in the market on the second Sunday of every month from 11am until 5pm.
We are happy to chat with you on most spiritual topics. Some of our books and booklets may help you with an issue you may be struggling with at the moment.
If you'd like some inspiring wisdom, spin the wheel and receive a spiritual gift or a quote on a range of life's challenges.

groupName: Soccer 4 fun not for professionals - have a fun with us
eventDetails:
If you are looking to play soccer(indoor) every sunday at around 11:30 in Dublin(Santry) JOIN US! Its an Indoor pitch 9 aside(big pitch). Most of us are Brazilian players but we also have Turkish and Russian players. ‚Ç¨10 per sunday or you can pay monthly.
GOALKEEPER PLAY FOR FREE! ------- Confirmation of attendance only after payment --------
if something happens with the event the money will get back to.
If you pay the event and don't show up at day you wont be refunded. Keep it on mind(you can send somebody else to play using your ticket) If you not sure of rules please feel free to contact me! PLAY WITH US AND HAVE A FUN.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME HERE.

eventDetails:
What were we all looking at ? I really can't remember!! This shot was taken at the back of Trooperstown Hill - more in the 'Bread & Butter' stone direction, but it shows the lie of the land pretty well - heather covered low hills!
I will decide on the exact route on the day when I see the weather, the lineup and the enthusiasm levels!! Expect 10 km at least, a little slopeage and good company.... Please note - there is a charge of ‚Ç¨10 per hike and I can supply poles to anyone who wants to borrow them.
eventName: A Sunday Trooperstown walk - a 10 km loop of the Avonmore Valley with some slope

eventDetails:
You'll meet your local guide at the meeting point a little before 11AM and show your booking. Then we'll commence a fascinating walking tour through the streets, sights, and sounds of Dublin old and new. You'll get an unrivalled insight to the history and culture that has shaped the capital you see today - warts and all, discover the lesser-known, intriguing oddities of our city, and get unique insider tips for the rest of your stay.
Sites and topics covered include:
Dublin Castle, Christchurch, Viking & Medieval Dublin, Temple Bar, fables, folklore and mythology, Trinity College, Stephen's Green, risings and rebellions, writers & rogues and so, so much more... please remember, places are limited and you must book your spot via: https://www.generationtours.com/dublin See you soon!
Through Brittas, Hollywood and across the Wicklow Gap

eventDetails: This Sunday morning comprises a short sit and a Puja. If you‚Äôre coming online, join via Zoom (password if required is sundaypuja) a few minutes before 11am.

Slow, relaxed running
followed by a ‚òïÔ∏è

Its canal side cycling most of the day today as we try out the newly opened grand canal Sallins greenway Distance 83 Km, flat as a pancake( or a crƒõpe) Here is our plan for the day. 1Ô∏è‚É£We leave Cafe Nero Grand Canal Dock at 930 am. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Cycle out along grand canal with a short detour off the canal at the 12th lock. 3Ô∏è‚É£ We stop for coffee/refreshments at
[Swans on the green] in Naas (https://maps.app.goo.gl/9GMYF4RsfjNdAqXn8)
4Ô∏è‚É£ We then cycle back by a slightly different route, through Ardclough Notes: ‚óè It is every participant's responsibility to ride safely, follow the rules of the road, and come prepared with the proper equipment.
